titlestmt.subtitle: A Guide to the Records at the Indiana University Archives

did.abstract: Founded on 12 December 1947 by Mrs. Herman T. Briscoe, the purpose of Gateway (General Association of Teachers, Employees, Wives, Administrators of the Yooniversity) was to promote sociability among the members of the entire University family. Membership was available to all women who were employed in any capacity by the University, to wives and other homemakers of persons employed by the university, and to all retired persons and widows who were eligible at the time of their retirement or widowhood. This collection contains one series arranged chronologically, Administrative files. Contained within this series are the Gateway Club minutes, the Presidents books, and a financial notice regarding the withdrawal of Gateway Club funds from the Indiana University Credit Union.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Founded on 12 December 1947 by Mrs. Herman T. Briscoe, the purpose of Gateway (General Association of Teachers, Employees, Wives, Administrators of the Yooniversity) was to promote sociability among the members of the entire University family. Membership was available to all women who were employed in any capacity by the University, to wives and other homemakers of persons employed by the university, and to all retired persons and widows who were eligible at the time of their retirement or widowhood. Membership would be terminated by failure to pay dues or the termination of one's association with the university.

Many Gateway meetings were centered on domesticity, with lessons on sewing, decorating, baking, and style. These "hobby" meetings were alternated with cultural meetings, which were generally led by professors at the university who lectured about their global travels and research. Each academic year was concluded with a Gateway picnic for members and their families.

The viability of Gateway was in question by April of 1962, as attendance at meetings had dwindled and as a core group of women dictated the club's direction. The April 1962 minutes were the last recorded, though no formal dissolution is mentioned.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has been organized into one series, Administrative files.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: This collection contains one series arranged chronologically, Administrative files. Contained within this series are the Gateway Club minutes, the Presidents books, and a financial notice regarding the withdrawal of Gateway Club funds from the Indiana University Credit Union.

The Minutes span the entirety of the Gateway Club's existence, 1947â1962, and are contained within one bound record book. Interesting entries include the initial inspiration for the founding of the Gateway Club, the initial efforts of Mrs. Herman T. Briscoe to arrange the group, and finally the internal complaints against the Gateway Club and the initial moves to disband the group.

The Presidents book is a valuable resource that contains materials from 1951 through 1962. Included are annual programs of events and meetings, lists of interest groups engaged within the Club, directories of the executive committees, membership lists from 1951 through 1962, the general guidelines of Gateway, and finally various newspaper clippings covering Gateway events.
The last folder contains a notice signed by Club officers requesting the withdrawal of Gateway Club's Building fund from the Indiana University Credit Union in April of 1961.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: For information regarding the copyright status of this collection, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Gateway Club (Indiana University) records, Collection C254, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

did.unittitle: Notice of Fund Withdrawal from the Indiana University Credit Union
